abstract: Microsoft and Yahoo have improved their search engines. But it will take both technology and marketing to convince Google users to switch.
snippet: Microsoft and Yahoo have improved their search engines. But it will take both technology and marketing to convince Google users to switch.
lead_paragraph: Bob Pittman, the former chief executive of America Online, may be associated with some of AOL’s excesses, but he knew a little about marketing. He understood that unlike early adopters who like to try new things, the mass consumer often finds that it’s the safest choice to go with a market leader. His slogan hit that point home: “AOL. So easy, no wonder it’s No. 1.”

headline.main: Image and Reality in the Search Wars
